0.Cons: You'll never want to eat there

1.Cons: Repetitive work, you will work past your schedule time to get almost every work day

2.Pros: Scheduling is very flexible. Great overall management. Fun atmosphere to work in. Free meals while working. Good customer service experience.
2.Cons: Slow increase in pay. I've been working for about a year and I am still at base pay. Low starting wage. Only 10% discount while not working.

3.Cons: very demanding and low pay for the amount of work

4.Pros: Pay raise twice a year and after each class completed. Training classes are available and they pay for certification. Free meals for management as well. Granteed hours.
4.Cons: Turnover rate is high for crew members. If you relocate, you would have to re apply to the next store. Its a lot of class work to get done and if you're at a busy store, you could go over you're hours and depending on management team that could be a problem.

5.Pros: Easy job. Great customers if you get their orders right and fast. This is a great job if you like moving a lot i.e. ADHD\ADD\OCD
5.Cons: Every manager is different. Some follows some policies others make their own. They tell you different "right" ways to do things

6.Pros: the schedule was some time easy to change

7.Pros: great first job to have for anyone
7.Cons: no work life balance at this place

8.Pros: Great Hours, fast paced, friendly co-workers
8.Cons: poor call in ratio's, working over nights,

9.Pros: Wanna try something different, and challenged myself to other opportunities.
9.Cons: Love working with my hands, why not get paid for it.
